output.conclusion: This course provides a foundational understanding of basic electrical engineering principles, preparing you for more advanced topics and practical applications.
output.introduction: Welcome to Basic Electrical Engineering! This course will introduce you to fundamental concepts such as circuits, components, and basic laws.  It is designed for individuals with an intermediate understanding of mathematics and physics.

chapters.description: Overview of voltage, current, resistance, and power. Units of measurement (Volts, Amperes, Ohms, Watts). Basic definitions and relationships.
Detailed explanation of Ohm's Law (V=IR). Applications and problem-solving examples. Understanding the relationship between voltage, current, and resistance.
Analysis of series circuits. Calculating total resistance, current, and voltage drops. Examples and applications.
Analysis of parallel circuits. Calculating total resistance, current division, and voltage. Examples and applications.
Types of resistors (carbon, film, wire-wound). Resistor color codes and tolerance. Power ratings of resistors.
Types of capacitors (ceramic, electrolytic, film). Capacitance, voltage rating, and applications. Charging and discharging of capacitors.
Understanding alternating current (AC) waveforms. Frequency, amplitude, and phase. Comparison with direct current (DC).
Explanation of Root Mean Square (RMS) values for AC voltage and current. Calculating RMS values and their significance.
Importance of electrical safety. Grounding, insulation, and circuit breakers. Safe practices when working with electricity.
Identifying common electrical faults. Using a multimeter for basic troubleshooting. Safety precautions during troubleshooting.
